titleStmt.title: Lauro, ac Laude Dignis S. P. D. G. S.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: Lauro, ac Laude Dignis S. P. D. G. S.

monogr.title: The history of Great Britanie : from the first peopling of this island to this present raigne of or [sic] happy and peacefull monarke K: Iames, by Will: Slatyer
monogr.author: Slatyer, William

div.head: Lauro, ac Laude Dignis S. P. D. G. S.
div.l: POets Laureate, on whose sacred browes
Flourish Garlands of ne're fading boughes,
Whose sweete layes more delicious beene,
Then Philomels or Paphos Queenes;
Helicon is yours, and though that I,
Cannot vp to the heauenly numbers flye,
Yet faine I doe admire you, and
Ee'n beg this boone at Phoebus hand,
To rest where in th'Elisian plaines,
Faire fields, I may heare your sweete straines,
Our Ennius, Chaucer, with old Line,
Or Orpheus, where, Sidney deuine
Sits with Musaeus; Johnson, Spencer,
Drayton, Daniel, English Horace, Homer,
Maro, Ouid; so sing 'twould inspire,
My dull Muse with deuiner fire.
Or if not; but with Eccho dombe,
Her Cradle needs must be her tombe,
Then sing her Requiem, much fam'd Cells,
Pyndus, Tempe, Troy, and Thames farewell.
